title: Mick Jones (The Clash guitarist)
summary: Michael Geoffrey Jones (born 26 June 1955) is a British musician, singer and songwriter best known as the lead guitarist, co-lead vocalist, co-founder and songwriter for The Clash until 1983.  In 1984, he formed Big Audio Dynamite with Don Letts. Jones has played with the group Carbon/Silicon along with Tony James since 2002 and was part of the Gorillaz live band for a world tour in 2010â€“2011. In late 2011, Jones collaborated with Pete Wylie and members of The Farm to form the Justice Tonight Band.
